Key Match Events: Luis García Jr. knocked his first leadoff homer of the season.
A string of singles from Jacob Young, Nasim Nuñez, García and Juan Yepez brought the score to 6-3.
The Nats were almost successful in their attempt to rally for a walk-off win, loading the bases with no outs on a pair of singles and a walk.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Martinez emphasized the importance of the series win against the Phillies, who are headed into the playoffs.

Martinez highlighted the growth and maturity of the young Nats, stating 'These guys got a lot of experience. We've seen some growth in a lot of those guys. We've seen some maturity in a lot of those guys.'
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Martinez expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win, saying 'It says a lot about our club and what they want. They're hungry. They want to beat the Philadelphia Phillies and all these other clubs that are in the playoffs.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nationals finished the season with a 71-91 record, the same as last year.
According to Jake Irvin, the team's record doesn't accurately reflect their accomplishments, as they have a lot of young players who made their debuts this year.
Others: The Nationals played well against a team headed into the postseason, winning the first two games of the series against the Phillies.
The team showed a lot of energy and enthusiasm in the series, particularly in front of a large crowd at Nationals Park.
